page.title: 06FARMING KNUTSFORD MOBBERLEY
page.content: The farming in this area is almost entirely dairy farming. There is some stock rearing and potato growing. The cereals that are grown are largely for the farmers' own use. Large areas of land are used for growing grass which is turned into silage - 3 crops a year is not unusual, and to a lesser extent hay is harvested. These are used for winter fodder. The grassland is intensively cultivated using chemical and natural fertilizers. Most farms are highly mechanised and employ few workers. Farms are often just big enough to be managed by the family. The milk produced on the farm is stored in cooled containers and collected daily by a bulk tanker to be taken to a large dairy supervised by the Milk Marketing Board. Many farms now have shops and sell potatoes, eggs and vegetables 'at the gate'.
